Class ProductionRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.ProductionRecord

  • public class ProductionRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    Production Record class is used to create objects of that type in order to produce a log of products.
    Author:
    Luis Hernandez

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProductionRecord(int productId)
      Constructor that uses productID to make a record but sets other fields to a default value.
      ProductionRecord(int productId, int productionNumber, java.lang.String serialNumber, java.util.Date dateProduced)
      Constructor that takes in id,number,serial,and date produced to create an object of production record.
      ProductionRecord(Product item, int count)
      Using a product and a count variable, this constructor creates a record of how many products to create.

        public ProductionRecord(int productId,
                        int productionNumber,
                        java.lang.String serialNumber,
                        java.util.Date dateProduced)
        Constructor that takes in id,number,serial,and date produced to create an object of production record.
        Parameters:
        productId - products generated id
        productionNumber - the number assigned to it after being produced
        serialNumber - programmed number after it is created
        dateProduced - time produced

      • ProductionRecord

        public ProductionRecord(Product item,
                        int count)
        Using a product and a count variable, this constructor creates a record of how many products to create.
        Parameters:
        item - product item that has name, manufacturer, type being produced
        count - updated variable to give unique serial number
